required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Stromal Vascular Fraction (SVF) Injection in the Treatment of Patellar Tendinopathy
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Infiltrative Treatment of Stromal Vascular Fraction in Patellar Tendinopathy

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is the evaluation of clinical and radiological results after the treatment of patellar tendinopathy through the injection of autologous ultrasound-guided, intra- and peri-tendon stromal vascular fraction.

detailed_description.textblock:
After being informed about the study and potential risks, all patients giving written informed consent will be treated according to the study protocol.
Every patients will undergo to a single peri- and intra- tendon injection with Autologous Stromal Vascula Fraction (SVF).
At baseline and at every follow-ups patients will be evaluated clinically and radiologically.
In particular, clinical evaluation and questionnaires will be performed at baseline, 1, 3, 6, 12 and 24 months visits, Ultrasound will be performed at baseline, 6 and 12 months visits. MRI will be performed at baseline and 6 months visits.

primary_outcome.measure: Victorian Institute of Sport Assessment-Patella (VISA-P) questionnaire
primary_outcome.description: VISA-P score is a questionnaire that assesses symptoms, simple tests of function, and the ability to play sports. It contains 8 questions about patellar tendinosis, max score for asymptomatic individual is 100; theoretical minimum is 0

secondary_outcome.measure: Victorian Institute of Sport Assessment-Patella (VISA-P) questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 1, 3, 6, and 12 months (at 24 month the questionnaire will be performed by telephone)
secondary_outcome.description: VISA-P score is a questionnaire that assesses symptoms, simple tests of function, and the ability to play sports. It contains 8 questions about patellar tendinosis, max score for asymptomatic individual is 100; theoretical minimum is 0

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 1, 3, 6, and 12 months (at 24 month the questionnaire will be performed by telephone)
secondary_outcome.description: EQ-VAS, which asks patients to indicate their overall health on a vertical visual analogue scale, ranging from "worst possible" to "best possible" health.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 1, 3, 6, and 12 months (at 24 month the questionnaire will be performed by telephone)
secondary_outcome.description: the EQ-5D profile, asks patients to classify their health based on self-assessed levels of problems ("no", "some", "extreme") on five dimensions.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 1, 3, 6, and 12 months (at 24 month the questionnaire will be performed by telephone)
secondary_outcome.description: Analogue scale represented by a line of 10 cm length, ranging from "absence of pain" to "the worst imaginable pain "

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 1, 3, 6, and 12 months (at 24 month the questionnaire will be performed by telephone)
secondary_outcome.description: Tegner's activity scale classifies the activity according to work and sports activities on a scale from 0 to 10. Zero represents disability because of knee problems and 10 represents soccer a national or international level.
ultrasound performing and thickness evaluation of the tendon

arm_group.description: intra- and peri-tendon ultrasound-guided injection of Stromal Vascular Fraction

intervention.description: intra- and peri-tendon ultrasound-guided injection of Stromal Vascular Fraction

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Ultrasound or MRI signs of patellar tendon pathology
Exclusion Criteria:
- BMI > 30
- Patients suffering from: rheumatic diseases, diabetes, infectious processes, epilepsy, severe osteoporosis
- Patients undergoing intra-tendon infiltration of another substance within the previous 6 months;
- Patients who had patellar tendon surgery within the previous 12 months;
- Immunodepression
- On going systemic inflammatory diseases (stabilized outcomes of such diseases are not considered absolute contraindications).
